required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Triferic AVNU Infusion Via Freedom Pump During Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Triferic AVNU Infusion Via Freedom Pump During Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the delivery of Triferic AVNU intravenously using the Freedom Pump-20 during hemodialysis into the pre-dialyzer and post-dialyzer blood lines.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single center, multi dose, open label study assessing the delivery of Triferic AVNU administered intravenously to adult patients (> or equal to 18 years of age) using the Freedom Pump-20 during hemodialysis into the pre-dialyzer and post-dialyzer blood lines.

primary_outcome.measure: Time for complete infusion of 4.5 mL Triferic AVNU pre-Dialyzer
Time for complete infusion of 4.5 mL Triferic AVNU post-Dialyzer

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pre- Dialyzer Infusion and Post- Dialyzer Infusion
arm_group.description: On study day 1, day 3 and day 5, patients will receive 6.75 mg Fe/4.5 mL Triferic AVNU intravenously using the Freedom Pump-20 during hemodialysis into the pre-dialyzer blood line. On study day 2, day 4 and day 6, patients will receive the 6.75 mg Fe/4.5 mL Triferic AVNU intravenously using the Freedom Pump-20 during hemodialysis into the post dialysis blood line.

intervention.arm_group_label: Pre- Dialyzer Infusion and Post- Dialyzer Infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participant must be 18 years of age inclusive, at the time of signing the informed consent.
2. Receiving chronic hemodialysis for 3-4 hours each session 3x/week.
3. Medically stable according to the investigator opinion
4. Capable of giving signed informed consent which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the informed consent form (ICF) and in this protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Hemodynamically unstable during hemodialysis
2. Evidence of active bleeding from the GI tract.
